Package business.entities

Class Monster

java.lang.Object
business.entities.Monster
Direct Known Subclasses:
BossMonster
public class Monster extends Object
Class representing a monster in the application's business model.

It provides a basic representation that holds the monster's name, challenge, experience points it provides, health points and combat information.

  • Constructor Details

    • Monster

      public Monster(String name, String challenge, int experience, int hitPoints, int initiative, String damageDice, String damageType)
      Constructor with name, challenge, experience, health points, initiative, damageDice and damageType parameters, for new monsters.
      Parameters:
      name - a string representation of the monster's name
      challenge - a string representation of the monster's challenge
      experience - an int representation of the monster's experience points it provides
      hitPoints - an int representation of the monster's health points
      initiative - an int representation of the monster's initiative
      damageDice - a string representation of the monster's damage dice
      damageType - a string representation of the monster's damage type

    • getDamage

      public int getDamage(int hit)
      Method that makes the monster calculate how much damage it will deal.
      Parameters:
      hit - an int representation of a d10 roll which determines if the attack is a hit, a critical hit or a miss
      Returns:
      an int representation of the damage the monster will deal

    • getTarget

      public int[] getTarget(ArrayList<Character> adventureParty, int[] targets)
      Method that makes the monster decide which character to target.
      Parameters:
      adventureParty - an array list of characters
      targets - an array of integers that represent the combatants that are targeted
      Returns:
      an array of integers that represent the combatants that are targeted
